intro: Sonchella stenoma, commonly known as the narrowleaf sonchus, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and alternate leaves that are typically lance-shaped. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in composite heads, which are typical of the daisy family. It is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and fields. Its botanical features make it a common weed in various regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
